reference: Karimi, B., Fatemi Ghomi, S.M.T., Wilson, J.M. "The capacitated lot sizing problem: a review of models and algorithms." Omega, 31(5), 365-378 (2003)
math_formula:
### Mathematical Model
Parameters:
- T: Number of periods in planning horizon
- n: Number of items
- d_{it}: Demand for item i in period t
- C_{it}: Unit production cost of item i in period t
- S_{it}: Setup cost for item i in period t
- h_{it}: Unit holding cost for item i in period t
- a_i: Resource consumption per unit of item i
- R_t: Available capacity in period t
- M_{it}: Upper bound on production of item i in period t (= Σ_{k=t}^T d_{ik})

Variables:
- X_{it}: Production amount of item i in period t
- I_{it}: Inventory of item i at end of period t (I_{i,t-1} + X_{it} - I_{it} = d_{it})
- Y_{it}: Binary setup variable for item i in period t

$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Minimize} && \sum_{i=1}^n \sum_{t=1}^T (S_{it}Y_{it} + C_{it}X_{it} + h_{it}I_{it}) \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{i=1}^n a_i X_{it} \leq R_t && \forall t=1,\ldots,T \\
& && I_{i,t-1} + X_{it} - I_{it} = d_{it} && \forall i,t \\
& && X_{it} \leq M_{it}Y_{it} && \forall i,t \\
& && Y_{it} \in \{0,1\}, X_{it} \geq 0, I_{it} \geq 0 && \forall i,t \\
& && I_{i0} = I_{iT} = 0 && \forall i
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example:
Consider a single-level production facility manufacturing multiple products over a 6-month horizon:

Production Environment:
* Product A:
  - Setup cost: $2000 per changeover
  - Production cost: $50/unit
  - Holding cost: $5/unit/month
  - Resource usage: 2 hours/unit
* Product B:
  - Setup cost: $1500 per changeover
  - Production cost: $40/unit
  - Holding cost: $4/unit/month
  - Resource usage: 1.5 hours/unit

Monthly Production Capacity: 400 machine hours

Monthly Demands:
* Product A: 150, 200, 180, 250, 220, 190 units
* Product B: 200, 180, 250, 220, 190, 210 units

The optimization problem determines:
1. Setup periods (Y_{it}): When to configure the production line for each product
2. Production quantities (X_{it}): How much to produce in each period
3. Inventory levels (I_{it}): How much inventory to carry forward

Constraints ensure:
1. Capacity: Total resource usage (Σ a_i X_{it}) ≤ Available capacity (R_t)
2. Inventory balance: Previous inventory + Production - Current inventory = Demand
3. Setup forcing: Production only occurs with setup (X_{it} ≤ M_{it}Y_{it})
4. Initial and final inventories are zero (I_{i0} = I_{iT} = 0)
